Title: Data Protection & Privacy Management Leader Sytorus Expands With New Team in Northern Ireland
Details:
Media Contact 
Colm Kelly 
colm.kelly@sytorus.com
Dublin, Ireland – 27/10/2020: Data protection software and solutions developer Sytorus is establishing a new distributed business services team in Northern Ireland. The move will create 13 new jobs and support international expansion for the Dublin-based company.
Sytorus develops and markets, PrivacyEngine™, a leading data privacy compliance platform that enables organizations to demonstrate compliance with rapidly changing privacy regulations such as GDPR. The investment is supported by Invest Northern Ireland, and recruitment is already underway to fill the new roles, which will include sales development account management, and consulting. 
“The onset of Covid-19 has resulted in more businesses shifting services online, further complicating compliance with international data privacy and data protection laws. The new team will support our data privacy experts to meet the rising demand for data privacy and protection solutions around the world,” said Dr John Ghent, CEO, Sytorus. 
Support form Invest Northern Ireland, including expert insight into the talent on offer, and emerging from local universities, was instrumental in Sytorus choosing Northern Ireland as the location for its latest expansion. The new employees will be recruited to work remotely across Northern Ireland. 
Derek Andrews, Head of International Investment at Invest Northern Ireland, said: “I am delighted to welcome Sytorus to Northern Ireland as part of our growing business services sector. Our guidance and financial support has helped bring the company to Northern Ireland to avail of this talent. The fact that these jobs are home-based is not only important during the current circumstances, but means Sytorus can continue to grow its presence across all areas of Northern Ireland long term.”
